component.name: azure-servicebus
component.title: Azure ServiceBus
component.description: Send and receive messages to/from Azure Event Bus.
component.label: cloud,messaging

amqpRetryOptions.label: common
amqpRetryOptions.description: Sets the retry options for Service Bus clients. If not specified, the default retry options are used.

amqpTransportType.label: common
amqpTransportType.description: Sets the transport type by which all the communication with Azure Service Bus occurs. Default value is AmqpTransportType#AMQP.

clientOptions.label: common
clientOptions.description: Sets the ClientOptions to be sent from the client built from this builder, enabling customization of certain properties, as well as support the addition of custom header information. Refer to the ClientOptions documentation for more information.

proxyOptions.label: common
proxyOptions.description: Sets the proxy configuration to use for ServiceBusSenderAsyncClient. When a proxy is configured, AmqpTransportType#AMQP_WEB_SOCKETS must be used for the transport type.

serviceBusType.label: common
serviceBusType.description: The service bus type of connection to execute. Queue is for typical queue option and topic for subscription based model.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

consumerOperation.label: consumer
consumerOperation.description: Sets the desired operation to be used in the consumer

disableAutoComplete.label: consumer
disableAutoComplete.description: Disables auto-complete and auto-abandon of received messages. By default, a successfully processed message is {link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#complete(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) completed}. If an error happens when the message is processed, it is {link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#abandon(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) abandoned}.

maxAutoLockRenewDuration.label: consumer
maxAutoLockRenewDuration.description: Sets the amount of time to continue auto-renewing the lock. Setting Duration#ZERO or null disables auto-renewal. For {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#RECEIVE_AND_DELETE RECEIVE_AND_DELETE} mode, auto-renewal is disabled.

peekNumMaxMessages.label: consumer
peekNumMaxMessages.description: Set the max number of messages to be peeked during the peek operation.

prefetchCount.label: consumer
prefetchCount.description: Sets the prefetch count of the receiver. For both {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#PEEK_LOCK PEEK_LOCK} and {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#RECEIVE_AND_DELETE RECEIVE_AND_DELETE} modes the default value is 1. Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#receiveMessages(). Setting a non-zero value will prefetch that number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off.

receiverAsyncClient.label: consumer
receiverAsyncClient.description: Sets the receiverAsyncClient in order to consume messages by the consumer

serviceBusReceiveMode.label: consumer
serviceBusReceiveMode.description: Sets the receive mode for the receiver.

subQueue.label: consumer
subQueue.description: Sets the type of the SubQueue to connect to.

subscriptionName.label: consumer
subscriptionName.description: Sets the name of the subscription in the topic to listen to. topicOrQueueName and serviceBusType=topic must also be set. This property is required if serviceBusType=topic and the consumer is in use.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

producerOperation.label: producer
producerOperation.description: Sets the desired operation to be used in the producer

scheduledEnqueueTime.label: producer
scheduledEnqueueTime.description: Sets OffsetDateTime at which the message should appear in the Service Bus queue or topic.

senderAsyncClient.label: producer
senderAsyncClient.description: Sets SenderAsyncClient to be used in the producer.

serviceBusTransactionContext.label: producer
serviceBusTransactionContext.description: Represents transaction in service. This object just contains transaction id.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

connectionString.label: security
connectionString.description: Sets the connection string for a Service Bus namespace or a specific Service Bus resource.

fullyQualifiedNamespace.label: security
fullyQualifiedNamespace.description: Fully Qualified Namespace of the service bus

tokenCredential.label: security
tokenCredential.description: A TokenCredential for Azure AD authentication, implemented in com.azure.identity

CamelAzureServiceBusApplicationPropertie.label: common
CamelAzureServiceBusApplicationPropertie.description: The application properties (also known as custom properties) on messages sent and received by the producer and consumer, respectively.

CamelAzureServiceBusContentType.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusContentType.description: Gets the content type of the message.

CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterErrorDescr.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterErrorDescr.description: Gets the description for a message that has been dead-lettered.

CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterReason.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterReason.description: Gets the reason a message was dead-lettered.

CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterSource.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusDeadLetterSource.description: Gets the name of the queue or subscription that this message was enqueued on, before it was dead-lettered.

CamelAzureServiceBusDeliveryCount.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusDeliveryCount.description: Gets the number of the times this message was delivered to clients.

CamelAzureServiceBusEnqueuedSequenceNumb.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusEnqueuedSequenceNumb.description: Gets the enqueued sequence number assigned to a message by Service Bus.

CamelAzureServiceBusEnqueuedTime.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusEnqueuedTime.description: Gets the datetime at which this message was enqueued in Azure Service Bus.

CamelAzureServiceBusExpiresAt.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusExpiresAt.description: Gets the datetime at which this message will expire.

CamelAzureServiceBusLockToken.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusLockToken.description: Gets the lock token for the current message.

CamelAzureServiceBusLockedUntil.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusLockedUntil.description: Gets the datetime at which the lock of this message expires.

CamelAzureServiceBusMessageId.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusMessageId.description: Gets the identifier for the message.

CamelAzureServiceBusPartitionKey.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusPartitionKey.description: Gets the partition key for sending a message to a partitioned entity.

CamelAzureServiceBusRawAmqpMessage.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusRawAmqpMessage.description: The representation of message as defined by AMQP protocol.

CamelAzureServiceBusReplyTo.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusReplyTo.description: Gets the address of an entity to send replies to.

CamelAzureServiceBusReplyToSessionId.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusReplyToSessionId.description: Gets or sets a session identifier augmenting the ReplyTo address.

CamelAzureServiceBusSequenceNumber.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusSequenceNumber.description: Gets the unique number assigned to a message by Service Bus.

CamelAzureServiceBusSessionId.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusSessionId.description: Gets the session id of the message.

CamelAzureServiceBusSubject.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusSubject.description: Gets the subject for the message.

CamelAzureServiceBusTimeToLive.label: consumer
CamelAzureServiceBusTimeToLive.description: Gets the duration before this message expires.

CamelAzureServiceBusScheduledEnqueueTime.description: (producer)Overrides the OffsetDateTime at which the message should appear in the Service Bus queue or topic. (consumer) Gets the scheduled enqueue time of this message.

CamelAzureServiceBusServiceBusTransactio.label: producer
CamelAzureServiceBusServiceBusTransactio.description: Overrides the transaction in service. This object just contains transaction id.

CamelAzureServiceBusProducerOperation.label: producer
CamelAzureServiceBusProducerOperation.description: Overrides the desired operation to be used in the producer.

topicOrQueueName.description: Selected topic name or the queue name, that is depending on serviceBusType config. For example if serviceBusType=queue, then this will be the queue name and if serviceBusType=topic, this will be the topic name.

amqpRetryOptions.label: common
amqpRetryOptions.description: Sets the retry options for Service Bus clients. If not specified, the default retry options are used.

amqpTransportType.label: common
amqpTransportType.description: Sets the transport type by which all the communication with Azure Service Bus occurs. Default value is AmqpTransportType#AMQP.

clientOptions.label: common
clientOptions.description: Sets the ClientOptions to be sent from the client built from this builder, enabling customization of certain properties, as well as support the addition of custom header information. Refer to the ClientOptions documentation for more information.

proxyOptions.label: common
proxyOptions.description: Sets the proxy configuration to use for ServiceBusSenderAsyncClient. When a proxy is configured, AmqpTransportType#AMQP_WEB_SOCKETS must be used for the transport type.

serviceBusType.label: common
serviceBusType.description: The service bus type of connection to execute. Queue is for typical queue option and topic for subscription based model.

consumerOperation.label: consumer
consumerOperation.description: Sets the desired operation to be used in the consumer

disableAutoComplete.label: consumer
disableAutoComplete.description: Disables auto-complete and auto-abandon of received messages. By default, a successfully processed message is {link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#complete(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) completed}. If an error happens when the message is processed, it is {link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#abandon(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) abandoned}.

maxAutoLockRenewDuration.label: consumer
maxAutoLockRenewDuration.description: Sets the amount of time to continue auto-renewing the lock. Setting Duration#ZERO or null disables auto-renewal. For {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#RECEIVE_AND_DELETE RECEIVE_AND_DELETE} mode, auto-renewal is disabled.

peekNumMaxMessages.label: consumer
peekNumMaxMessages.description: Set the max number of messages to be peeked during the peek operation.

prefetchCount.label: consumer
prefetchCount.description: Sets the prefetch count of the receiver. For both {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#PEEK_LOCK PEEK_LOCK} and {link ServiceBusReceiveMode#RECEIVE_AND_DELETE RECEIVE_AND_DELETE} modes the default value is 1. Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#receiveMessages(). Setting a non-zero value will prefetch that number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off.

receiverAsyncClient.label: consumer
receiverAsyncClient.description: Sets the receiverAsyncClient in order to consume messages by the consumer

serviceBusReceiveMode.label: consumer
serviceBusReceiveMode.description: Sets the receive mode for the receiver.

subQueue.label: consumer
subQueue.description: Sets the type of the SubQueue to connect to.

subscriptionName.label: consumer
subscriptionName.description: Sets the name of the subscription in the topic to listen to. topicOrQueueName and serviceBusType=topic must also be set. This property is required if serviceBusType=topic and the consumer is in use.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

producerOperation.label: producer
producerOperation.description: Sets the desired operation to be used in the producer

scheduledEnqueueTime.label: producer
scheduledEnqueueTime.description: Sets OffsetDateTime at which the message should appear in the Service Bus queue or topic.

senderAsyncClient.label: producer
senderAsyncClient.description: Sets SenderAsyncClient to be used in the producer.

serviceBusTransactionContext.label: producer
serviceBusTransactionContext.description: Represents transaction in service. This object just contains transaction id.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

connectionString.label: security
connectionString.description: Sets the connection string for a Service Bus namespace or a specific Service Bus resource.

fullyQualifiedNamespace.label: security
fullyQualifiedNamespace.description: Fully Qualified Namespace of the service bus

tokenCredential.label: security
tokenCredential.description: A TokenCredential for Azure AD authentication, implemented in com.azure.identity
